items.title:
üáßüá∑ New Brazilian buffet tour

This one is interesting because it's inside a church

Brazil (like Sou...
items.content:
üáßüá∑ New Brazilian buffet tour

This one is interesting because it's inside a church

Brazil (like South America) is VERY religious, 87% of the population is Christian

Compare that to the Netherlands, where I'm from, where it's now just 30%, and similar for large parts of Europe, which is ironic because Christendom of course came from Europe

Many things in Brazil and South America are ironic where they are in ways more European than Europe is these days

Many churches here like the one in my video at the end are Evangelical, a conservative type of Protestantism. The churches remind me a bit of those TV churces you'd see in the US. Much bigger and more modern than we generally have in Europe

Anyway back to the buffet, as always lots of meat and veggies and rice and beans, it can be very healthy if you pick right. And you self-check out by weighing the food and paying per kilogram, very smooth

Also free coffee is included! Unfortunately in plastic cups (unacceptable üòÇ) so we skipped that one but nice

My lunch was 788 gram for $13 at $17/kg

Every time I post about this I get cancelled by Brazilian for being "a dumb foreigner paying too much" which may be correct as I am starting to realize Curitiba and South Brazil are NOT cheap

Then again nowhere is cheap anymore with currency devaluation

Apparently the Brazilian government also organizes these buffets cheaper but subsidized by them to help everyone get fed, so it'd be cool to show you that one next time ‚úåÔ∏è
items.author: @levelsio
items.summary: Levelsio posting a detailed vlog/thread about Brazilian buffet culture, food prices, and cultural observations about religion in Brazil.
items.reasoning: Completely off-topic travel/food content.

Many things in Brazil and South America are ironic where they are in ways more European than Europe is these days

Many churches here like the one in my video at the end are Evangelical, a conservative type of Protestantism. The churches remind me a bit of those TV churces you'd see in the US. Much bigger and more modern than we generally have in Europe

Anyway back to the buffet, as always lots of meat and veggies and rice and beans, it can be very healthy if you pick right. And you self-check out by weighing the food and paying per kilogram, very smooth

Also free coffee is included! Unfortunately in plastic cups (unacceptable üòÇ) so we skipped that one but nice

My lunch was 788 gram for $13 at $17/kg

Every time I post about this I get cancelled by Brazilian for being "a dumb foreigner paying too much" which may be correct as I am starting to realize Curitiba and South Brazil are NOT cheap

Then again nowhere is cheap anymore with currency devaluation

Apparently the Brazilian government also organizes these buffets cheaper but subsidized by them to help everyone get fed, so it'd be cool to show you that one next time ‚úåÔ∏è

items.title:
I'm not a stoner and only smoke weed once or twice a year if anything

But the anxiety simply means ...
items.content:
I'm not a stoner and only smoke weed once or twice a year if anything

But the anxiety simply means it works, like psychedelics (it's not btw) it gives you a portal into your own mind

If it gives you panic attacks it usually means there's something in your mind you haven't resolved yet, like once I started realizing my mortality with an extreme sense but that's good because I should be realizing that (for example)

That's too uncomfortable for most to accept though so "weed gives you panic attacks" it is
items.author: @levelsio
items.summary: Levelsio shares thoughts on weed and anxiety.
items.reasoning: Off-topic from AI/ML.
items.summary_html: Levelsio shares thoughts on weed and anxiety.

But the anxiety simply means it works, like psychedelics (it's not btw) it gives you a portal into your own mind

If it gives you panic attacks it usually means there's something in your mind you haven't resolved yet, like once I started realizing my mortality with an extreme sense but that's good because I should be realizing that (for example)
